title: old letterhead font
content:
Any font identification would be much appreciated. The customer wants us to recreate some stationery using the font from a REALLY old business card.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819081545im_/http:/typophile.com/files/James_4650.jpg)

Thank You
author: kuccellini

comments.content: with some customization on /J & /i you may use **[Grover](http://web.archive.org/web/20130819081545/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Sudtipos&ffam=Grover%20-%20Regular&fid=bce940e46bea8ccc238d08fc8f7685d2&fsize=36&text=inTJmE%20OLCHSA&fit=1)** by Sudtipos, with the exception of that /e which is really off and reminds me of a Greek /ε [or a Cyrilic one?] - I don't know
You are right! The flipped 3 is very close indeed ;)
